content.body: bakkot: I don't think so; there's still cross-browser agreement to remove the feature, so the spec reflects that.
content.formatted_body: bakkot: I don't think so; there's still cross-browser agreement to remove the feature, so the spec reflects that.

content.body: Individual shipping decisions are up to browsers to communicate as they wish.
as someone coming across that thread, I would find it useful to know that Chrome's intent is to remove the feature _not before January 2022_, rather than to remove it as soon as resources permit
content.formatted_body: as someone coming across that thread, I would find it useful to know that Chrome's intent is to remove the feature not before January 2022, rather than to remove it as soon as resources permit

content.body: not suggesting a change to the spec, just an informative post in the thread

content.body: By the way, while I support that change, I can also say it did break quite a few embedded interactive examples at MDN
But those are entirely or almost entirely cases of examples that were using `alert()`, which is just bad anyway. So we're gonna fix those regardless.
https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/7566
